Hebrew: הַמַּשָּׂא֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָזָ֔ה חֲבַקּ֖וּק הַנָּבִֽיא׃
Translated: The pronouncement made by the prophet Habakkuk.
Transliteration: hamasha asher chazah chavakuk hanaviy

Hebrew: עַד־אָ֧נָה יְהֹוָ֛ה שִׁוַּ֖עְתִּי וְלֹ֣א תִשְׁמָ֑ע אֶזְעַ֥ק אֵלֶ֛יךָ חָמָ֖ס וְלֹ֥א תוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
Translated:
How long, O ETERNAL One, shall I cry out
And You not listen,
Shall I shout to You, “Violence!”
And You not save?
Transliteration: ad-anah yehovah shivaetiy velo tishema ezeak eleykha chamas velo tvoshiya

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה תַרְאֵ֤נִי אָ֙וֶן֙ וְעָמָ֣ל תַּבִּ֔יט וְשֹׁ֥ד וְחָמָ֖ס לְנֶגְדִּ֑י וַיְהִ֧י רִ֦יב וּמָד֖וֹן יִשָּֽׂא׃
Translated:
Why do You make me see iniquity
[Why] do You look upon wrong?—
Raiding and violence are before me,
Strife continues and contention goes on.
Transliteration: lamah tareeniy aven veamal taviyt veshod vechamas lenegediy vayehiy riyv umadvon yisha

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ תָּפ֣וּג תּוֹרָ֔ה וְלֹא־יֵצֵ֥א לָנֶ֖צַח מִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּ֤י רָשָׁע֙ מַכְתִּ֣יר אֶת־הַצַּדִּ֔יק עַל־כֵּ֛ן יֵצֵ֥א מִשְׁפָּ֖ט מְעֻקָּֽל׃
Translated:
That is why decision fails
And justice never emerges;
For villains hedge in those whose cause is just—
Therefore judgment emerges deformed.
Transliteration: al-khen tafug tvorah velo-eitse lanetsach mishefat khiy rasha makhetiyr et-hatsadiyk al-khen eitse mishefat meukal

Hebrew: רְא֤וּ בַגּוֹיִם֙ וְֽהַבִּ֔יטוּ וְהִֽתַּמְּה֖וּ תְּמָ֑הוּ כִּי־פֹ֙עַל֙ פֹּעֵ֣ל בִּימֵיכֶ֔ם לֹ֥א תַאֲמִ֖ינוּ כִּ֥י יְסֻפָּֽר׃
Translated:
“Look among the nations,
Observe well and be utterly astounded;
For a work is being wrought in your days
That you would not believe if it were told.
Transliteration: reu vagvoyim vehaviytu vehitamehu temahu khiy-foal foel viymeykhem lo taamiynu khiy yesufar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנְנִ֤י מֵקִים֙ אֶת־הַכַּשְׂדִּ֔ים הַגּ֖וֹי הַמַּ֣ר וְהַנִּמְהָ֑ר הַהוֹלֵךְ֙ לְמֶרְחֲבֵי־אֶ֔רֶץ לָרֶ֖שֶׁת מִשְׁכָּנ֥וֹת לֹּא־לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
For lo, I am raising up the Chaldeans,
That fierce, impetuous nation,
Who cross the earth’s wide spaces
To seize homes not their own.
Transliteration: khiy-hineniy mekiym et-hakhashediym hagvoy hamar vehanimehar hahvolekhe lemerechavey-erets lareshet mishekhanvot lo-lvo

Hebrew: אָיֹ֥ם וְנוֹרָ֖א ה֑וּא מִמֶּ֕נּוּ מִשְׁפָּט֥וֹ וּשְׂאֵת֖וֹ יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated:
They are terrible, dreadful;
They make their own laws and rules.
Transliteration: ayom venvora hu mimenu mishefatvo usheetvo eitse

Hebrew: וְקַלּ֨וּ מִנְּמֵרִ֜ים סוּסָ֗יו וְחַדּוּ֙ מִזְּאֵ֣בֵי עֶ֔רֶב וּפָ֖שׁוּ פָּרָשָׁ֑יו וּפָֽרָשָׁיו֙ מֵרָח֣וֹק יָבֹ֔אוּ יָעֻ֕פוּ כְּנֶ֖שֶׁר חָ֥שׁ לֶאֱכֽוֹל׃
Translated:
Their horses are swifter than leopards,
Fleeter than wolves of the steppe.
Their steeds gallop—their steeds
Come flying from afar.
Like vultures rushing toward food,
Transliteration: vekalu minemeriym susayv vechadu mizeevey erev ufashu farashayv ufarashayv merachvok yavou yaufu khenesher chash leekhvol

Hebrew: כֻּלֹּה֙ לְחָמָ֣ס יָב֔וֹא מְגַמַּ֥ת פְּנֵיהֶ֖ם קָדִ֑ימָה וַיֶּאֱסֹ֥ף כַּח֖וֹל שֶֽׁבִי׃
Translated:
They all come, bent on rapine.
The thrust of their van is forward,
And they amass captives like sand.
Transliteration: khuloh lechamas yavvo megamat feneyhem kadiymah vayeesof khachvol sheviy

Hebrew: וְהוּא֙ בַּמְּלָכִ֣ים יִתְקַלָּ֔ס וְרֹזְנִ֖ים מִשְׂחָ֣ק ל֑וֹ ה֚וּא לְכׇל־מִבְצָ֣ר יִשְׂחָ֔ק וַיִּצְבֹּ֥ר עָפָ֖ר וַֽיִּלְכְּדָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Kings they hold in derision,
And princes are a joke to them;
They laugh at every fortress,
They pile up earth and capture it.
Transliteration: vehu vamelakhiym yitekalas verozeniym mishechak lvo hu lekhׇl-mivetsar yishechak vayitsevor afar vayilekhedah

Hebrew: אָ֣ז חָלַ֥ף ר֛וּחַ וַֽיַּעֲבֹ֖ר וְאָשֵׁ֑ם ז֥וּ כֹח֖וֹ לֵאלֹהֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Then they pass on like the wind,
They transgress and incur guilt,
For they ascribe their might to their god.”
Transliteration: az chalaf rucha vayaavor veashem zu khochvo lelohvo

Hebrew: הֲל֧וֹא אַתָּ֣ה מִקֶּ֗דֶם יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהַ֛י קְדֹשִׁ֖י לֹ֣א נָמ֑וּת יְהֹוָה֙ לְמִשְׁפָּ֣ט שַׂמְתּ֔וֹ וְצ֖וּר לְהוֹכִ֥יחַ יְסַדְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
You, O ETERNAL One, are from everlasting;
My holy God, You never die.
O ETERNAL One, You have made them a subject of contention;
O Rock, You have made them a cause for complaint.
Transliteration: halvo atah mikedem yehovah elohay kedoshiy lo namut yehovah lemishefat shametvo vetsur lehvokhiycha yesadetvo

Hebrew: טְה֤וֹר עֵינַ֙יִם֙ מֵרְא֣וֹת רָ֔ע וְהַבִּ֥יט אֶל־עָמָ֖ל לֹ֣א תוּכָ֑ל לָ֤מָּה תַבִּיט֙ בּֽוֹגְדִ֔ים תַּחֲרִ֕ישׁ בְּבַלַּ֥ע רָשָׁ֖ע צַדִּ֥יק מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
You whose eyes are too pure to look upon evil,
Who cannot countenance wrongdoing,
Why do You countenance treachery,
And stand by idle
While the one in the wrong devours
The one in the right?
Transliteration: tehvor eynayiim merevot ra vehaviyt el-amal lo tukhal lamah taviyt vvogediym tachariysh vevala rasha tsadiyk mimenu

Hebrew: וַתַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה אָדָ֖ם כִּדְגֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם כְּרֶ֖מֶשׂ לֹא־מֹשֵׁ֥ל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
You have made humankind like the fish of the sea,
Like creeping things that have no ruler.
Transliteration: vataasheh adam khidegey hayam kheremesh lo-moshel vvo

Hebrew: כֻּלֹּה֙ בְּחַכָּ֣ה הֵֽעֲלָ֔ה יְגֹרֵ֣הוּ בְחֶרְמ֔וֹ וְיַאַסְפֵ֖הוּ בְּמִכְמַרְתּ֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֖ן יִשְׂמַ֥ח וְיָגִֽיל׃
Translated:
He has fished them all up with a line,
Pulled them up in his trawl,
And gathered them in his net.
That is why he rejoices and is glad.
Transliteration: khuloh vechakhah healah yegorehu vecheremvo veyaasefehu vemikhemaretvo al-khen yishemach veyagiyl

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ יְזַבֵּ֣חַ לְחֶרְמ֔וֹ וִֽיקַטֵּ֖ר לְמִכְמַרְתּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י בָהֵ֙מָּה֙ שָׁמֵ֣ן חֶלְק֔וֹ וּמַאֲכָל֖וֹ בְּרִאָֽה׃
Translated:
That is why he sacrifices to his trawl
And makes offerings to his net;
For through them his portion is rich
And his nourishment fat.
Transliteration: al-khen yezavecha lecheremvo viykater lemikhemaretvo khiy vahemah shamen chelekvo umaakhalvo veriah

Hebrew: הַ֥עַל כֵּ֖ן יָרִ֣יק חֶרְמ֑וֹ וְתָמִ֛יד לַהֲרֹ֥ג גּוֹיִ֖ם לֹ֥א יַחְמֽוֹל׃ {ס}
Translated:
Shall he then keep emptying his trawl,
And slaying nations without pity?
Transliteration: haal khen yariyk cheremvo vetamiyd laharog gvoyim lo yachemvol {s}

Hebrew: עַל־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֣י אֶֽעֱמֹ֔דָה וְאֶֽתְיַצְּבָ֖ה עַל־מָצ֑וֹר וַאֲצַפֶּ֗ה לִרְאוֹת֙ מַה־יְדַבֶּר־בִּ֔י וּמָ֥ה אָשִׁ֖יב עַל־תּוֹכַחְתִּֽי׃
Translated:
I will stand on my watch,
Take up my station at the post,
And wait to see what [God] will say to me,
What will be the reply to my complaint.
Transliteration: al-mishemaretiy eemodah veeteyatsevah al-matsvor vaatsafeh lirevot mah-yedaver-viy umah ashiyv al-tvokhachetiy

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָה֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר כְּתֹ֣ב חָז֔וֹן וּבָאֵ֖ר עַל־הַלֻּח֑וֹת לְמַ֥עַן יָר֖וּץ ק֥וֹרֵא בֽוֹ׃
Translated:
GOD answered me and said:
Write the prophecy down,
Inscribe it clearly on tablets,
So that it can be read easily.
Transliteration: vayaaneniy yehovah vayomer khetov chazvon uvaer al-haluchvot lemaan yaruts kvore vvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ע֤וֹד חָזוֹן֙ לַמּוֹעֵ֔ד וְיָפֵ֥חַ לַקֵּ֖ץ וְלֹ֣א יְכַזֵּ֑ב אִם־יִתְמַהְמָהּ֙ חַכֵּה־ל֔וֹ כִּי־בֹ֥א יָבֹ֖א לֹ֥א יְאַחֵֽר׃
Translated:
For there is yet a prophecy for a set term,
A truthful witness for a time that will come.
Even if it tarries, wait for it still;
For it will surely come, without delay:
Transliteration: khiy vod chazvon lamvoed veyafecha lakets velo yekhazev im-yitemahemah chakheh-lvo khiy-vo yavo lo yeacher

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה עֻפְּלָ֔ה לֹא־יָשְׁרָ֥ה נַפְשׁ֖וֹ בּ֑וֹ וְצַדִּ֖יק בֶּאֱמוּנָת֥וֹ יִֽחְיֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
Lo, their spirit within them is puffed up, not upright,
But the righteous are rewarded with life
For their fidelity.
Transliteration: hineh ufelah lo-yasherah nafeshvo vvo vetsadiyk veemunatvo yicheyeh {s}

Hebrew: וְאַף֙ כִּֽי־הַיַּ֣יִן בֹּגֵ֔ד גֶּ֥בֶר יָהִ֖יר וְלֹ֣א יִנְוֶ֑ה אֲשֶׁר֩ הִרְחִ֨יב כִּשְׁא֜וֹל נַפְשׁ֗וֹ וְה֤וּא כַמָּ֙וֶת֙ וְלֹ֣א יִשְׂבָּ֔ע וַיֶּאֱסֹ֤ף אֵלָיו֙ כׇּל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וַיִּקְבֹּ֥ץ אֵלָ֖יו כׇּל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
Translated:
How much less then shall the defiant go unpunished,
The treacherous, the arrogant
Who have made their maw as wide as Sheol,
Who are as insatiable as Death,
Who have harvested all the nations
And gathered in all the peoples!
Transliteration: veaf khiy-hayayiin voged gever yahiyr velo yineveh asher hirechiyv khishevol nafeshvo vehu khamavet velo yisheva vayeesof elayv khׇl-hagvoyim vayikevots elayv khׇl-haamiym

Hebrew: הֲלוֹא־אֵ֣לֶּה כֻלָּ֗ם עָלָיו֙ מָשָׁ֣ל יִשָּׂ֔אוּ וּמְלִיצָ֖ה חִיד֣וֹת ל֑וֹ וְיֹאמַ֗ר ה֚וֹי הַמַּרְבֶּ֣ה לֹּא־ל֔וֹ עַד־מָתַ֕י וּמַכְבִּ֥יד עָלָ֖יו עַבְטִֽיט׃
Translated:
Surely all these shall pronounce a satire against them,
A pointed epigram concerning them.
They shall say:
Ah, you who pile up what is not yours—
How much longer?—
And make ever heavier your load of indebtedness!
Transliteration: halvo-eleh khulam alayv mashal yishau umeliytsah chiydvot lvo veyomar hvoy hamareveh lo-lvo ad-matay umakheviyd alayv avetiyt

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא פֶ֗תַע יָק֙וּמוּ֙ נֹֽשְׁכֶ֔יךָ וְיִקְצ֖וּ מְזַעְזְעֶ֑יךָ וְהָיִ֥יתָ לִמְשִׁסּ֖וֹת לָֽמוֹ׃
Translated:
Right suddenly will your creditors arise,
And those who remind you will awake,
And you will be despoiled by them.
Transliteration: halvo feta yakumu noshekheykha veyiketsu mezaezeeykha vehayiyta limeshisvot lamvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה שַׁלּ֙וֹתָ֙ גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֔ים יְשׇׁלּ֖וּךָ כׇּל־יֶ֣תֶר עַמִּ֑ים מִדְּמֵ֤י אָדָם֙ וַֽחֲמַס־אֶ֔רֶץ קִרְיָ֖ה וְכׇל־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Because you plundered many nations,
All surviving peoples shall plunder you—
For crimes against humans and wrongs against lands,
Against cities and all their inhabitants.
Transliteration: khiy-atah shalvota gvoyim raviym yeshׇlukha khׇl-yeter amiym midemey adam vachamas-erets kireyah vekhׇl-yoshevey vah {f}

Hebrew: ה֗וֹי בֹּצֵ֛עַ בֶּ֥צַע רָ֖ע לְבֵית֑וֹ לָשׂ֤וּם בַּמָּרוֹם֙ קִנּ֔וֹ לְהִנָּצֵ֖ל מִכַּף־רָֽע׃
Translated:
Ah, you who have acquired gains
To the detriment of your own house,
Who have destroyed many peoples
In order to set your nest on high
To escape disaster!
Transliteration: hvoy votsea vetsa ra leveytvo lashum vamarvom kinvo lehinatsel mikhaf-ra

Hebrew: יָעַ֥צְתָּ בֹּ֖שֶׁת לְבֵיתֶ֑ךָ קְצוֹת־עַמִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים וְחוֹטֵ֥א נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
Translated:
You have plotted shame for your own house,
And guilt for yourself;
Transliteration: yaatseta voshet leveytekha ketsvot-amiym raviym vechvote nafeshekha

Hebrew: כִּי־אֶ֖בֶן מִקִּ֣יר תִּזְעָ֑ק וְכָפִ֖יס מֵעֵ֥ץ יַעֲנֶֽנָּה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For a stone shall cry out from the wall,
And a rafter shall answer it from the woodwork.
Transliteration: khiy-even mikiyr tizeak vekhafiys meets yaanenah {f}

Hebrew: ה֛וֹי בֹּנֶ֥ה עִ֖יר בְּדָמִ֑ים וְכוֹנֵ֥ן קִרְיָ֖ה בְּעַוְלָֽה׃
Translated:
Ah, you who have built a town with crime,
And established a city with infamy,
Transliteration: hvoy voneh iyr vedamiym vekhvonen kireyah veavelah

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא הִנֵּ֔ה מֵאֵ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת וְיִֽיגְע֤וּ עַמִּים֙ בְּדֵי־אֵ֔שׁ וּלְאֻמִּ֖ים בְּדֵי־רִ֥יק יִעָֽפוּ׃
Translated:
So that peoples have had to toil for the fire,
And nations to weary themselves for naught!
Behold, it is from GOD of Hosts:
Transliteration: halvo hineh meet yehovah tsevavot veyiygeu amiym vedey-esh uleumiym vedey-riyk yiafu

Hebrew: כִּ֚י תִּמָּלֵ֣א הָאָ֔רֶץ לָדַ֖עַת אֶת־כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּמַּ֖יִם יְכַסּ֥וּ עַל־יָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
For the earth shall be filled
With awe for GOD’s glory
As water covers the sea.
Transliteration: khiy timale haarets ladaat et-khevvod yehovah khamayiim yekhasu al-yam {f}

Hebrew: ה֚וֹי מַשְׁקֵ֣ה רֵעֵ֔הוּ מְסַפֵּ֥חַ חֲמָתְךָ֖ וְאַ֣ף שַׁכֵּ֑ר לְמַ֥עַן הַבִּ֖יט עַל־מְעוֹרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Ah, you who make others drink to intoxication
As you pour out your wrath,
In order to gaze upon their nakedness!
Transliteration: hvoy mashekeh reehu mesafecha chamatekha veaf shakher lemaan haviyt al-mevoreyhem

Hebrew: שָׂבַ֤עְתָּ קָלוֹן֙ מִכָּב֔וֹד שְׁתֵ֥ה גַם־אַ֖תָּה וְהֵעָרֵ֑ל תִּסּ֣וֹב עָלֶ֗יךָ כּ֚וֹס יְמִ֣ין יְהֹוָ֔ה וְקִיקָל֖וֹן עַל־כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
You shall be sated with shame
Rather than glory:
Drink in your turn and stagger!
The cup in GOD’s right hand
Shall come around to you,
And disgrace to your glory.
Transliteration: shavaeta kalvon mikhavvod sheteh gam-atah vehearel tisvov aleykha khvos yemiyn yehovah vekiykalvon al-khevvodekha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י חֲמַ֤ס לְבָנוֹן֙ יְכַסֶּ֔ךָּ וְשֹׁ֥ד בְּהֵמ֖וֹת יְחִיתַ֑ן מִדְּמֵ֤י אָדָם֙ וַחֲמַס־אֶ֔רֶץ קִרְיָ֖ה וְכׇל־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
Translated:
For the lawlessness against Lebanon shall cover you,
The destruction of animals shall overwhelm you—
For crimes against humans and wrongs against lands,
Against cities and all their inhabitants.
Transliteration: khiy chamas levanvon yekhasekha veshod vehemvot yechiytan midemey adam vachamas-erets kireyah vekhׇl-yoshevey vah

Hebrew: מָה־הוֹעִ֣יל פֶּ֗סֶל כִּ֤י פְסָלוֹ֙ יֹֽצְר֔וֹ מַסֵּכָ֖ה וּמ֣וֹרֶה שָּׁ֑קֶר כִּ֣י בָטַ֞ח יֹצֵ֤ר יִצְרוֹ֙ עָלָ֔יו לַעֲשׂ֖וֹת אֱלִילִ֥ים אִלְּמִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated:
What has the carved image availed,
That its maker has carved it
For an image and a false oracle—
That the one who makes an item has trusted in it,
Producing dumb idols?
Transliteration: mah-hvoiyl fesel khiy fesalvo yotservo masekhah umvoreh shaker khiy vatach yotser yitservo alayv laashvot eliyliym ilemiym {s}

Hebrew: ה֣וֹי אֹמֵ֤ר לָעֵץ֙ הָקִ֔יצָה ע֖וּרִי לְאֶ֣בֶן דּוּמָ֑ם ה֣וּא יוֹרֶ֔ה הִנֵּה־ה֗וּא תָּפוּשׂ֙ זָהָ֣ב וָכֶ֔סֶף וְכׇל־ר֖וּחַ אֵ֥ין בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Ah, you who say, “Wake up” to wood,
“Awaken,” to inert stone!
Can that give an oracle?
Why, it is encased in gold and silver,
But there is no breath inside it.
Transliteration: hvoy omer laets hakiytsah uriy leeven dumam hu yvoreh hineh-hu tafush zahav vakhesef vekhׇl-rucha eyn vekirevvo

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֖ה בְּהֵיכַ֣ל קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ הַ֥ס מִפָּנָ֖יו כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated:
But GOD in the holy Abode—
Be silent before [God], all the earth!
Transliteration: vayhovah veheykhal kׇdeshvo has mifanayv khׇl-haarets {s}

Hebrew: תְּפִלָּ֖ה לַחֲבַקּ֣וּק הַנָּבִ֑יא עַ֖ל שִׁגְיֹנֽוֹת׃
Translated: A prayer of the prophet Habakkuk. In the mode of Shigionoth.
Transliteration: tefilah lachavakuk hanaviy al shigeyonvot

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֗ה שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי שִׁמְעֲךָ֮ יָרֵ֒אתִי֒ יְהֹוָ֗ה פׇּֽעׇלְךָ֙ בְּקֶ֤רֶב שָׁנִים֙ חַיֵּ֔יהוּ בְּקֶ֥רֶב שָׁנִ֖ים תּוֹדִ֑יעַ בְּרֹ֖גֶז רַחֵ֥ם תִּזְכּֽוֹר׃
Translated:
O ETERNAL One! I have learned of Your renown;
I am awed, O ETERNAL One, by Your deeds.
Renew them in these years,
Oh, make them known in these years!
Though angry, may You remember compassion.
Transliteration: yehovah shamaetiy shimeakha yaretiy yehovah fׇׇlekha vekerev shaniym chayeyhu vekerev shaniym tvodiya verogez rachem tizekhvor

Hebrew: אֱל֙וֹהַּ֙ מִתֵּימָ֣ן יָב֔וֹא וְקָד֥וֹשׁ מֵהַר־פָּארָ֖ן סֶ֑לָה כִּסָּ֤ה שָׁמַ֙יִם֙ הוֹד֔וֹ וּתְהִלָּת֖וֹ מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
God is coming from Teman,
The Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah.
God’s majesty covers the skies,
Such splendor fills the earth:
Transliteration: elvoha miteyman yavvo vekadvosh mehar-faran selah khisah shamayiim hvodvo utehilatvo maleah haarets

Hebrew: וְנֹ֙גַהּ֙ כָּא֣וֹר תִּֽהְיֶ֔ה קַרְנַ֥יִם מִיָּד֖וֹ ל֑וֹ וְשָׁ֖ם חֶבְי֥וֹן עֻזֹּֽה׃
Translated:
It is a brilliant light
That gives off rays on every side—
And therein God’s glory is enveloped.
Transliteration: venogah khavor tiheyeh karenayiim miyadvo lvo vesham cheveyvon uzoh

Hebrew: לְפָנָ֖יו יֵ֣לֶךְ דָּ֑בֶר וְיֵצֵ֥א רֶ֖שֶׁף לְרַגְלָֽיו׃
Translated:
Pestilence marches in front,
And plague comes forth at God’s heels.
Transliteration: lefanayv eilekhe daver veeitse reshef leragelayv

Hebrew: עָמַ֣ד ׀ וַיְמֹ֣דֶד אֶ֗רֶץ רָאָה֙ וַיַּתֵּ֣ר גּוֹיִ֔ם וַיִּתְפֹּֽצְצוּ֙ הַרְרֵי־עַ֔ד שַׁח֖וּ גִּבְע֣וֹת עוֹלָ֑ם הֲלִיכ֥וֹת עוֹלָ֖ם לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
God’s standing up makes the earth shake;
A mere glance makes nations tremble.
The age-old mountains are shattered,
The primeval hills sink low.
God’s routes are ancient:
Transliteration: amad vayemoded erets raah vayater gvoyim vayitefotsetsu harerey-ad shachu givevot volam haliykhvot volam lvo

Hebrew: תַּ֣חַת אָ֔וֶן רָאִ֖יתִי אׇהֳלֵ֣י כוּשָׁ֑ן יִרְגְּז֕וּן יְרִיע֖וֹת אֶ֥רֶץ מִדְיָֽן׃
Translated:
As a scene of havoc I behold
The tents of Cushan;
Shaken are the pavilions
Of the land of Midian!
Transliteration: tachat aven raiytiy ׇholey khushan yiregezun yeriyvot erets mideyan

Hebrew: הֲבִנְהָרִים֙ חָרָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה אִ֤ם בַּנְּהָרִים֙ אַפֶּ֔ךָ אִם־בַּיָּ֖ם עֶבְרָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י תִרְכַּב֙ עַל־סוּסֶ֔יךָ מַרְכְּבֹתֶ֖יךָ יְשׁוּעָֽה׃
Translated:
Are You wroth, O ETERNAL One, with Neharim?
Is Your anger against Neharim,
Your rage against Yam—
That You are driving Your steeds,
Your victorious chariot?
Transliteration: havinehariym charah yehovah im vanehariym afekha im-vayam everatekha khiy tirekhav al-suseykha marekhevoteykha yeshuah

Hebrew: עֶרְיָ֤ה תֵעוֹר֙ קַשְׁתֶּ֔ךָ שְׁבֻע֥וֹת מַטּ֖וֹת אֹ֣מֶר סֶ֑לָה נְהָר֖וֹת תְּבַקַּע־אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
All bared and ready is Your bow.
Sworn are the rods of the word. Selah.
You make the earth burst into streams,
Transliteration: ereyah tevor kashetekha shevuvot matvot omer selah neharvot tevaka-arets

Hebrew: רָא֤וּךָ יָחִ֙ילוּ֙ הָרִ֔ים זֶ֥רֶם מַ֖יִם עָבָ֑ר נָתַ֤ן תְּהוֹם֙ קוֹל֔וֹ ר֖וֹם יָדֵ֥יהוּ נָשָֽׂא׃
Translated:
The mountains rock at the sight of You,
A torrent of rain comes down;
Loud roars the deep,
The sky returns the echo.
Transliteration: raukha yachiylu hariym zerem mayiim avar natan tehvom kvolvo rvom yadeyhu nasha

Hebrew: שֶׁ֥מֶשׁ יָרֵ֖חַ עָ֣מַד זְבֻ֑לָה לְא֤וֹר חִצֶּ֙יךָ֙ יְהַלֵּ֔כוּ לְנֹ֖גַהּ בְּרַ֥ק חֲנִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated:
Sun [and] moon stand still on high
As Your arrows fly in brightness,
Your flashing spear in brilliance.
Transliteration: shemesh yarecha amad zevulah levor chitseykha yehalekhu lenogah verak chaniytekha

Hebrew: בְּזַ֖עַם תִּצְעַד־אָ֑רֶץ בְּאַ֖ף תָּד֥וּשׁ גּוֹיִֽם׃
Translated:
You tread the earth in rage,
You trample nations in fury.
Transliteration: vezaam titsead-arets veaf tadush gvoyim

Hebrew: יָצָ֙אתָ֙ לְיֵ֣שַׁע עַמֶּ֔ךָ לְיֵ֖שַׁע אֶת־מְשִׁיחֶ֑ךָ מָחַ֤צְתָּ רֹּאשׁ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית רָשָׁ֔ע עָר֛וֹת יְס֥וֹד עַד־צַוָּ֖אר סֶֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated:
You have come forth to deliver Your people,
To deliver Your anointed.
You will smash the roof of the villain’s house,
Raze it from foundation to top. Selah.
Transliteration: yatsata leeisha amekha leeisha et-meshiychekha machatseta rosh miveyt rasha arvot yesvod ad-tsavar selah {f}

Hebrew: נָקַ֤בְתָּ בְמַטָּיו֙ רֹ֣אשׁ פְּרָזָ֔ו יִסְעֲר֖וּ לַהֲפִיצֵ֑נִי עֲלִ֣יצֻתָ֔ם כְּמוֹ־לֶאֱכֹ֥ל עָנִ֖י בַּמִּסְתָּֽר׃
Translated:
You will crack [the enemy’s] skull with Your bludgeon;
Blown away shall be his warriors,
Whose delight is to crush me suddenly,
To devour a pauper in an ambush.
Transliteration: nakaveta vematayv rosh ferazav yisearu lahafiytseniy aliytsutam khemvo-leekhol aniy vamisetar

Hebrew: דָּרַ֥כְתָּ בַיָּ֖ם סוּסֶ֑יךָ חֹ֖מֶר מַ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
You will make Your steeds tread the sea,
Stirring the mighty waters.
Transliteration: darakheta vayam suseykha chomer mayiim raviym

Hebrew: שָׁמַ֣עְתִּי ׀ וַתִּרְגַּ֣ז בִּטְנִ֗י לְקוֹל֙ צָלְל֣וּ שְׂפָתַ֔י יָב֥וֹא רָקָ֛ב בַּעֲצָמַ֖י וְתַחְתַּ֣י אֶרְגָּ֑ז אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָנ֙וּחַ֙ לְי֣וֹם צָרָ֔ה לַעֲל֖וֹת לְעַ֥ם יְגוּדֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated:
I heard and my bowels quaked,
My lips quivered at the sound;
Rot entered into my bone,
I trembled where I stood.
Yet I wait calmly for the day of distress,
For a people to come to attack us.
Transliteration: shamaetiy vatiregaz viteniy lekvol tsalelu shefatay yavvo rakav vaatsamay vetachetay eregaz asher anucha leyvom tsarah laalvot leam yegudenu

Hebrew: כִּֽי־תְאֵנָ֣ה לֹֽא־תִפְרָ֗ח וְאֵ֤ין יְבוּל֙ בַּגְּפָנִ֔ים כִּחֵשׁ֙ מַֽעֲשֵׂה־זַ֔יִת וּשְׁדֵמ֖וֹת לֹא־עָ֣שָׂה אֹ֑כֶל גָּזַ֤ר מִמִּכְלָה֙ צֹ֔אן וְאֵ֥ין בָּקָ֖ר בָּרְפָתִֽים׃
Translated:
Though the fig tree does not bud
And no yield is on the vine,
Though the olive crop has failed
And the fields produce no grain,
Though sheep have vanished from the fold
And no cattle are in the pen,
Transliteration: khiy-teenah lo-tiferach veeyn yevul vagefaniym khichesh maasheh-zayiit ushedemvot lo-ashah okhel gazar mimikhelah tson veeyn vakar varefatiym

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֖י בַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֶעְל֑וֹזָה אָגִ֖ילָה בֵּאלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעִֽי׃
Translated:
Yet will I rejoice in GOD,
Exult in the God who delivers me.
Transliteration: vaaniy vayhovah eelvozah agiylah velohey yisheiy

Hebrew: יֱהֹוִ֤ה אֲדֹנָי֙ חֵילִ֔י וַיָּ֤שֶׂם רַגְלַי֙ כָּאַיָּל֔וֹת וְעַ֥ל בָּמוֹתַ֖י יַדְרִכֵ֑נִי לַמְנַצֵּ֖חַ בִּנְגִינוֹתָֽי׃
Translated:
The Sovereign GOD is my strength,
Making my feet like the deer’s
And letting me stride upon the heights.
For the leader; with instrumental music.
Transliteration: yehovih adonay cheyliy vayashem ragelay khaayalvot veal vamvotay yaderikheniy lamenatsecha vinegiynvotay
